src:
Lietadlo Superjet núdzovo pristálo na Sibíri po zlyhaní motora
Lietadlo smerovalo z Ťumenu do Petrohradu, bolo v ňom aj šesť členov posádky.
01 Nov 2019, 22:05 by MOSKVA/TASR
Ruské dopravné lietadlo Suchoj Superjet 100 (SSJ-100) v piatok núdzovo pristálo v sibírskom meste Ťumeň po tom, ako mu vypovedal motor. Žiaden z 80 pasažierov na palube neutrpel zranenia. S odvolaním sa na miestnych predstaviteľov o tom informovali agentúry TASS a AFP.
Lietadlo prevádzkované leteckou spoločnosťou Jamal smerovalo z mesta Ťumeň do Petrohradu, na palube bolo aj šesť členov posádky. Motor stoju zlyhal krátko po štarte, keď doň vtiahlo vtáka, uviedla hovorkyňa aerolínií pre agentúru RIA Novosti. Cestujúcim podľa spoločnosti poskytnú náhradný let.
Predstaviteľ regionálnej kancelárie ministerstva pre mimoriadne situácie pre TASS spresnil, že pohotovostné zložky už opúšťajú ťumenské letisko. "Lietadlo pristálo bezpečne. Žiaden z pasažierov nepotreboval pomoc," povedal zdroj.
Začiatkom mája tohto roka lietadlo typu SSJ-100 pri tvrdom núdzovom pristátí na moskovskom letisku Šeremetievo zachvátili plamene, nehoda si vyžiadala 41 životov. Stroj sa vracal na Šeremetievo po tom, ako ho počas letu zasiahol blesk.
Rusko predstavilo stroj Suchoj Superjet 100 v roku 2007 ako svoje prvé postsovietske dopravné lietadlo a možného súpera medzinárodných konkurentov ako je kanadský Bombardier. Jeho výrobu však poznačili zdržania a problémy, preto malo Rusko ťažkosti presviedčať zahraničné letecké spoločnosti, aby ho zakúpili.
V roku 2012 pri predvádzacom lete v Indonézii narazilo lietadlo tohto typu do vrcholu neaktívnej sopky Salak, pričom zahynulo všetkých 45 ľudí na palube. Indonézske úrady vtedy uviedli, že nehodu zavinil pilot.
text:
Superjet aircraft crash-landed in Siberia after engine failure
The aircraft was heading from Tyumen to St. Petersburg, including six crew members.
01 Nov 2019, 21:05 by MOSKVA / TASR
A Russian airliner Sukhoi Superjet 100 (SSJ-100) crash-landed on Friday in the Siberian city of Tyumen after the engine was told. None of the 80 passengers aboard suffered injuries. With reference to local officials, they informed the TASS and AFP.
The aircraft operated by the Jamal airline was directed from Tyumen to St. Petersburg, with six crew members on board. The stall engine failed shortly after start when a bird was drawn in, an airline spokeswoman for RIA Novosti said. According to the company, they will provide passengers with an alternative flight.
A representative of the regional office of the Ministry of Emergency Situations for TASS specified that the emergency services are already leaving the airport in Tyumen. "The plane landed safely. None of the passengers needed help," the source said.
In early May this year, the aircraft type SSJ-100 at a hard emergency landing at Moscow Sheremetyevo airport engulfed in flames, the accident claimed 41 lives. The machine returned to Sheremetyevo after being struck by lightning during the flight.
Russia introduced the Sukhoi Superjet 100 in 2007 as its first post-Soviet transport aircraft and a possible rival to international competitors such as the Canadian Bombardier. However, its production was marked by delays and problems, so Russia had difficulties in persuading foreign airlines to buy it.
In 2012, during a demonstration flight in Indonesia, an aircraft of this type hit the top of the inactive Salak volcano, killing all 45 people on board. The Indonesian authorities said the pilot had caused the accident.
